Brun Chief Operating Officer Director of Membership tbrun@thelegendclubs.com Sue Prei Director of Accounting sprei@thelegendclubs.com David Bobber Director of Golf dbobber@thelegendclubs.com Multi-Club Management Jamie Sandin Director of Event Sales jsandin@thelegendclubs.com Judy Navarro IT Director jnavarro@thelegendclubs.com TJ Boinski Membership Sales Associate tboinski@thelegendclubs.com Maxx McGinnis Media Specialist mmcginnis@thelegendclubs.com Crystal Stutz Accounts Payable ap@thelegendclubs.com Jake Szaniawski Administrative Assistant jszaniawski@thelegendclubs.com The Legend at Brandybrook Managers Josh Minsky Head Golf Professional jminsky@thelegendclubs.com Jake Renner Golf Course Superintendent jrenner@thelegendclubs.com Keith Foster, C.S.C. Executive Chef kfoster@thelegendclubs.com Jackie Fellin Clubhouse Manager jfellin@thelegendclubs.com Ryan Kratky Service Manager rkratky@thelegendclubs.com The Legend at Merrill Hills Managers Alex Johansen Head Golf Professional ajohansen@thelegendclubs.com Randy VanFleet Golf Course Superintendent rvanfleet@thelegendclubs.com Jason Herbrand Executive Chef jherbrand@thelegendclubs.com Marty Hersh Clubhouse Manager mhersh@thelegendclubs.com Jessica Gault Service Manager jgault@thelegendclubs.com The Legend at Bristlecone Managers Nathan Goecks Head Golf Professional ngoecks@thelegendclubs.com Mark Robel Golf Course Superintendent mrobel@thelegendclubs.com Clayton Cass Executive Chef ccass@thelegendclubs.com George Renner Clubhouse Manager grenner@thelegendclubs.com Megan Haynes Service Manager mhaynes@thelegendclubs.com Brett Phalen Service Manager bphalen@thelegendclubs.com The Legend at Bergamont Managers Brad Petashnick Head Golf Professional & Membership Director bpetashnick@thelegendclubs.com Jered Kamin Golf Course Superintendent jkamin@thelegendatbergamont.com Joe Learned Executive Chef jlearned@thelegendatbergamont.com Megan Torok Membership Sales Associate mtorok@thelegendatbergamont.com Melissa Wooten Event Sales Manager mwooten@thelegendatbergamont.com Join Today! Click to schedule a tour. "The finest clubs, like family traditions, trace their roots to strong contributions by individuals. These individuals create the environment in which camaraderie flourishes and new friendships begin. These individuals are called Members.‚Äù LIVE THE LEGEND! For membership information, call Chief Operating Officer & Director of Membership, Tom Brun¬†at 262-968-9717. ¬© Copyright 2025. All rights reserved. FAQs Staff Members Staff Members Staff Members Home Executive director jack aschenbach PGA Golf Professional ‚Äì jackaschenbach@pga.com Jack Aschenbach has been the Executive Director since 2012 and is a well-recognized and respected professional in the PGA, Northern Chapter of the North Florida Section PGA and our North Florida Communities. Jack is the past President of the Northern Chapter, North Florida PGA where he served in office from October 2008 ‚Äì August 2014 and continues to serve today on various committees. His professional golf career started in June of 1995 at Mayport Golf Club (1995-1999). Jack then was hired on with ClubCorp of America for the next eight years where he worked at Deercreek Country and Queen‚Äôs Harbour Yacht and Country Club (1999-2006). He was elected into PGA Membership in 2003 later becoming the Head Golf Professional at Queen‚Äôs Harbour Yacht and Country Club (2003-2006) with a follow on six year stay at Amelia National Country Club before taking over and revamping the NFJG Foundation and Tour. Jack is a decorated Veteran of the United States Navy, serving our Nation for 23 years and is a¬† 21 time PGA Award Winner. He enjoys teaching our Veterans and is actively involved in¬† the ‚ÄúPGA HOPE‚Äù program. Jack was inducted into the North Florida PGA ‚ÄúHall of Fame‚Äù in May of 2020 and was the recipient of the 2018, 2019, 2020 and 2024 Northern Chapter and North Florida Section PGA Youth Player Development Award and was the 2014 Northern Chapter and Section PGA Professional of the Year .¬† He also was named the 2011 Northern Chapter PGA Professional of the Year in concert with receiving the 2011 Bill Stausbaugh Award . A four-time recipient of the ‚Äú Patriot Award ‚Äù and a five-time recipient of the Northern Chapter and North Florida Section Assistant Golf Professional of the Year Award . Jack‚Äôs outstanding contributions in the promotion and development of junior golf, reflect the ideals of those who work with youth. His distinguished service in mentoring other PGA professionals, integrity and character reflect positively upon the profession and outstanding involvement in charitable and community affairs. Jack is a proud native of Sheboygan, Wisconsin raised in a family of 11 brothers and sisters and has lived in Jacksonville for the past 30 years. He is married to his wife Debbie for over 44 years. They have two adult children, Sara and Shawn and three grandchildren Jordyn, Jaxsyn and Addy. Jack Loves fishing and watching his Green Bay Packers! Contact Jack teams our staff At the North Florida Junior Golf Foundation in Jacksonville, Florida, we serve the needs of each of our young members. gary murfitt, PGA Rules official lynn kirkpatrick, LPGA Rules official Jody Clark Tournament Operations Manager susan waite , PGA rules official mark heeter rules official Don Moore rules official rules official rules official community join NFJGTOUR TEAM ON BEHALF OF OUR OVER 400 JUNIOR MEMBERS AND PARENTS OF THE NORTH FLORIDA JUNIOR GOLF FOUNDATION AND TOUR, WE WOULD LIKE TO INVITE YOU AND YOUR COMPANY TO BE A PARTNER OF OUR TOURNAMENT SEASON AND HELP US CELEBRATE OVER 30 YEARS OF DEVELOPING AND PROMOTING JUNIOR GOLF. Customized package are available to fit your needs. Please let us know if you have different ideas on how your company may get involved. contact us sponsorship packages Facebook ¬© 2024 North Florida Junior Golf Foundation. All rights reserved. Email Subscribe Gary Murfitt's Bio Rules Official PGA Professional ‚Äì UNF Golfplex Gary grew up in the small town of Brook Indiana. He played golf 4 years on his varsity High School Golf Team and set all the schools scoring records. In his junior year he was selected onto the All American High School Golf Team. That year he shot 65, 6 times, also finishing 3rd place in the state finials. He went on to play for Ball State University for 2 years, and played in the NCAA Championship his freshman year. Gary moved to Florida in 1984, and turned professional. He played the Space Coast Tour for 5 years in the early 1980‚Äôs. He starting working at Hyde Park Golf Club in 1986 and went into the PGA Program were he spent most of his career until June 2017, as Head Golf Professional and Instructor. He has been teaching golf for the last 36 years and now is able to focus on teaching the game he loves full time to golfers of all ages, beginners to professional. He also enjoys working with the North Florida Junior Golf Tour, mentoring and coaching juniors in this wonderful game. Wife: Laura, Children: Johnny and Michelle, Grandchildren: Nicole, Sierra, Riley and Ellie. LYNN KIRKPATRICK, LPGA's Bio Golf Development Lead Instructor / Rules Official LPGA Golf Professional ‚Äì University of North Florida Lynne has been a rules official with NFJG since the summer of 2007. Actively involved in growing junior golf Lynne is the NFJG Duval County Middle School Golf Coordinator and the TEE IT UP Coordinator.  Lynne‚Äôs children Kyle, Sean and Brian have also participated in the program.

Born and raised in Philadelphia, Lynne was introduced to golf through a junior program. She competed in city and state tournaments throughout her junior years. Lynne attended Appalachian State University and played on the women‚Äôs golf team.

Lynne is currently an LPGA Teaching Instructor at the GolfPlex @ University of North Florida. She is also the Head Golf Coach for the Bishop Kenny High School Girl‚Äôs golf team. Her passion is in junior golf having developed and conducted many junior programs in the area. Jody Clark's Bio NFJG TOUR Tournament Operations Manager Jody is currently the ‚ÄúTournament Operations Manager‚Äù with the North Florida Junior Golf Tour and is responsible for Tournament Day operations and pretournament preparations. Jody has worked in golf business for over 20 years. She recently held a position as the 1st Assistant/Pro Shop Manager at Deercreek Country Club and worked at Hidden Hills Country Club from June 2009-May 2017. Prior to Hidden Hills she worked at Deercreek Country Club (2003-2009) and Mill Cove Golf Course (2001-2003). Born and raised in Orange Park, Jody would play golf periodically with her dad, aunt and uncle growing up. Her teenage and college years were spent playing volleyball. After graduating from Flagler College, Jody‚Äôs afternoons, evenings and weekends consisted of coaching high school and travel volleyball teams. Weekday mornings she would head up to Mill Cove and play golf. This is when her passion and love for the game ignited and would lead to her first job and future in the golf industry. Susan Waite's Bio Rules Official PGA Professional ‚Äì The First Tee of North Florida As a Navy Brat, I had the privilege of living in Italy while I was in sixth and seventh grade, living on the United States Naval Academy during eighth, ninth and tenth grade, before settling in Jacksonville to round out my High School years as a Robert E. Lee Fighting General! I‚Äôve always enjoyed sports, and as a young girl learned to play soccer in the streets of Naples, Italy. However, upon returning to the States, soccer wasn‚Äôt too popular and I turned to basketball and softball. In college, during a one-year sabbatical between my sophomore and junior years, I was fortunate enough to take up The Game of Golf, played everyday, and eventually ‚Äúwalked on‚Äù to the Lady Gator Golf Team. During college I found myself constantly seeking part-time summer and holiday breaks working in the golf business at various country clubs. Upon graduating from The University of Florida, College of Journalism and Communications, my love of golf (and connections made therein) lead to a sales position with IZOD LaCoste in Pittsburgh, PA. Using my amateur golf skills as a means to succeed in the ‚Äúreal working world‚Äù (again, all the connections made on the golf course) I was encouraged to turn my love of The Game into a profession. I accepted a full-time position in the Ponce de Leon Golf Shop, and after two failed attempts, practiced hard and long enough to pass the PGA Player Ability Test. After enjoying 20 years as an assistant golf professional at The Ponce, Deercreek Country Club, and San Jose Country Club, as a First Tee Coach, and a Rules Official with The North Florida Junior Golf Tour, I can now enjoy and experience what I never played‚Ä¶Junior Golf! Mark Heeter's bio Rules Official Retired Mark Heeter has been a rules official with NFJG TOUR since the spring of 2015. Mark was born and raised in northern Ohio. He spent the majority of his working career in the automotive and trucking industry. His skills and training led him to the management side of the business and for 18 years, as Service Director, he led an award-winning service department of a Chrysler, Dodge, and Jeep dealership. Mark started golfing at the age of 14, but was focused on pole vaulting throughout high school and into college. As an adult his focus changed to the game of golf, where he played on several golf leagues and begin spending time on his game in hopes of moving to Florida some-day to pursue a career as a professional golfer. In 1999 Mark moved to Jacksonville Florida to pursue his dream. In an effort to help fund his training, Mark joined Windsor Parke Golf Club as a member but was soon offered a position as an assistant in the golf shop. Having a solid business background, he entered the PGA training program and in 2004 was offered and accepted the position of Head Golf Professional/Director of Golf at Windsor Parke. He remained in that capacity till 2015 when the course was sold and Mark retired. Mark traded his dream of becoming a professional golfer for being an excellent golf professional, honing his teaching skills, conducting successful junior golf camps and helping junior golfers pursue their dreams. His knowledge of the game, his easy-going attitude, sense of humor, and admiration for the kids that play the game, make him a good fit for the NFJG team. Don Moore Bio Rules Official Don has been a Rules Official for NFJG since the fall of 2024. Don is an aspiring PGA professional who began his golf journey in 2018. He is the president and co-founder of Purple Heart Golf, an ambassador to the PGA Hope program, Director with the Jacksonville Area Golf Association, and active member with the Veteran‚Äôs Golf Association where he was recognized as a flighted 2021 National Champion. Don is a 20 year retired U.S. Army Military Police Officer having served three tours to Iraq and Afghanistan, and performing duties such as Police Chief, Commander, Drill Sergeant, S.W.A.T. team leader, and Paratrooper. His awards and decorations include the Legion of Merit, Bronze Star Medal, and Purple Heart. After his military service, Don began his second career as an executive fundraiser which eventually brought him to Wounded Warrior Project and the Jacksonville area.

Jacksonville Golf & Country Club | LinkedIn Skip to main content LinkedIn Top Content People Learning Jobs Games Sign in Join now Jacksonville Golf & Country Club Hospitality Jacksonville, Florida 606 followers Follow View all 79 employees Report this company About us Established in 1989, Jacksonville Golf and Country Club is a private, member-owned country club centrally located on Florida's First Coast between shimmering beaches just a few minutes to our east and downtown Jacksonville to the west. Over the years it has become one of the most desirable gated communities and country clubs in the area. Our members enjoy a lifestyle with limitless recreational and social opportunities. We invite you to visit the Club for a guided tour and to experience what our members have been enjoying for a quarter century - an active, family-friendly private club that provides service second to none in a relaxed, comfortable, and safe environment. Our beautiful 25,000 square foot Clubhouse boasts sweeping views of our signature 18-hole championship golf course and of our Garden Terrace waterfall where blushing brides instantly envision saying their "I do's". Once inside the Clubhouse you'll discover 3 separate dining rooms (including an adults only dining room), ample banquet and private meeting space, a fitness center and group exercise room, locker rooms, spa services, golf pro shop and more. Outdoors, those seeking an active lifestyle won't be disappointed with 10 clay tennis courts, a junior Olympic size heated lap and recreation pool, playground, and golf practice facilities. At the centerpiece of the Club, our golf course, designed by Clyde Johnston and Fuzzy Zoeller, is highly regarded for its impeccable course conditions and renowned for being challenging and enjoyable for players of all handicap levels. Whether you are planning a wedding or special event or considering enhancing your lifestyle by becoming a member, we are confident that Jacksonville Golf and Country Club will exceed your expectations. We look forward to serving you! Website http://www.jaxgcc.com External link for Jacksonville Golf & Country Club Industry Hospitality Company size 51-200 employees Headquarters Jacksonville, Florida Type Privately Held Founded 1989 Locations Primary 3985 Hunt Club Rd Jacksonville, Florida 32224-8416, US Get directions Employees at Jacksonville Golf & Country Club Mike McDermand Jennifer Schroeder Jones Membership Director at Jacksonville Golf & Country Club Shana Gianzero Pastry Chef at Jacksonville Golf & Country Club Jessica Morgan Stop asking WHY, and start asking WHY NOT See all employees Updates Jacksonville Golf & Country Club 606 followers 4mo Report this post Jacksonville Golf & Country Club Members Approve Transformational $30 Million Enhancement Plan

Jacksonville, FL ‚Äì Tuesday, April 29, 2025 

We are excited to share exciting news from Jacksonville Golf & Country Club (JGCC). Our members have overwhelmingly approved the "Blueprint for Tomorrow," a comprehensive enhancement plan that includes:

-An 18,000-square-foot clubhouse expansion featuring new indoor/outdoor dining, fitness, and resort-style pool facilities.
-A complete renovation and redesign of our championship golf course, led by renowned architect Andy Staples.

This initiative represents a significant investment ($30,000,000) in our community and aims to elevate the member experience while attracting new families to the area.

Jacksonville, FL ‚Äì Tuesday, April 29, 2025 

We are excited to share exciting news from Jacksonville Golf & Country Club (JGCC). Our members have overwhelmingly approved the "Blueprint for Tomorrow," a comprehensive enhancement plan that includes:

-An 18,000-square-foot clubhouse expansion featuring new indoor/outdoor dining, fitness, and resort-style pool facilities.
-A complete renovation and redesign of our championship golf course, led by renowned architect Andy Staples.

This initiative represents a significant investment ($30,000,000) in our community and aims to elevate the member experience while attracting new families to the area.

                                    Baths 3,251 SqFt Residential MLS¬Æ # 2090386 WATSON REALTY CORP View All 12 Results Jacksonville Golf & Country Club Jacksonville Golf & Country Club, developed in the late 1980‚Äôs by Arvida Corp/JMB Partners, is a gated community in the Beaches/Southside area of town between Hodges and Beach Boulevard. All of the 900+ homes in Jax Golf were built to take advantage of the gorgeous natural landscape offered in this part of town. Homes generally line the golf course, lakes and preserves providing immensely peaceful views. Members of the Jacksonville Golf & Country Club enjoy the 26,000 square foot clubhouse tastefully designed and overlooking the #9 and #18 greens of the lush green golf course. Perks of membership include clubhouse dining, golf (of course), a heated Olympic-sized swimming pool, tennis with 10 lighted Har-Tru clay courts, fitness, and a playground. The championship golf course was designed by both Clyde Johns and Fuzzy Zoeler is a big draw to membership. Club member activities are focused on both adult and children's events. The initiation fee to join the Jacksonville Golf & Country Club is just $15,000; compared to other clubs in the area, this is quite less expensive. Jacksonville Golf Community & Culture Regardless of there being over 900 families in Jax Golf, there is still a tight-knit community feel with activities and clubs to participate in. The Women‚Äôs Network includes a bridge club, book circle, cooking classes, fundraisers, and more. Jacksonville Golf includes Woodland Parke, a 3+ acre recreational area complete with a full basketball court, pickleball, workout obstacle course plus baseball and soccer field, pavilion areas with picnic tables, benches, and grills. Jacksonville Golf Location Jacksonville Golf is a country club community located in Northeast Florida between Hodges Boulevard and Beach Boulevard and gets five stars for convenience to just about anywhere in the Greater Jacksonville area. J. Turner Butler Blvd is just 2 miles south of the community for easy access to the I-295 Beltway and I-95. A trip into Downtown Jacksonville will take only 20 minutes, the airport just 30 minutes and the beach a quick 12-minute drive east! Jacksonville Golf Homeowners Association The Jacksonville Golf & Country Club HOA website provides lots of useful information on the neighborhood including the community Covenants & Restrictions for those considering purchasing a home. The HOA dues are payable quarterly.¬† For questions regarding the community, Jacksonville Golf and Country Club is managed by Vesta Property Services at 904-747-0181. Jacksonville Golf Real Estate If you‚Äôre looking for a Jacksonville Golf home for sale, here‚Äôs what you need to know about the neighborhood. Unfortunately, if you‚Äôve fallen in love with the community and looking to build your dream home, there a no vacant lots in Jax Golf to build on. There is, however, much to choose from in style, size, and location. Homes in Jacksonville Golf & Country Club come in all shapes and sizes including traditional, ranch, and contemporary styles with one or two stories. Views are plentiful in Jacksonville Golf Country Club with homes lining the golf course, neighborhood ponds and preserve areas. Hear from Jacksonville Golf Residents Q: What do you LOVE about Jacksonville Golf & CC? JGCC has a great central location in Jacksonville, situated between downtown and the beaches. This makes a drive to the airport or the beaches a quick drive. The St Johns Town Center is ten minutes away and positioned near the J Turner Butler artery offering quick access to the main highways. The community has a mature landscaping canopy and the Association does a great job of keeping homeowners on top of their maintenance so there are very few homes that appear neglected. ‚ÄìBrad K Q: What do people get wrong about Jacksonville Golf & CC? People don‚Äôt realize that the community offers tremendous amenities such as golf, tennis, and swimming that are just as nice as the major clubs at the beaches for a much more modest price. The members-owned club continues to invest in and improve these amenities and keep them in top condition. -Brad K Q: Do you use the Jacksonville Golf & CC membership? I play golf at the club at least 2-3 times per week and my wife plays tennis 3-4 times per week while my teenage daughter has taken up tennis in the past year as well. -Brad K Q: What DON‚ÄôT people know about Jacksonville Golf & CC? It‚Äôs a tremendous family community. Though there is certainly a mix of young and old there is a large segment of families with school-age children which gives the community a vibrant feel. -Brad K Q: What would you improve about Jacksonville Golf & CC? Increase the membership fees! Higher fees = Higher value. Compared to other clubs in town, JGCC is much less expensive. -Brad K Browse Other Florida Beach Communities We Serve Atlantic Beach Jacksonville Beach Neptune Beach Nocatee Ponte Vedra Beach South Ponte Vedra Contact The Volen Group today for help with your next home. Jacksonville Golf and Country Club Welcome to Jacksonville Golf and Country Club, centrally located to the beaches and downtown. This elegant gated residential community showcases a newly renovated Fuzzy Zoeler designed golf course and award-winning tennis facility with a 26,000 square-foot clubhouse that welcomes you any day of the week for fine dining experience and catering services for special events. Residents enjoy a magnificent low country-style clubhouse majestically overlooking the twin signature 9th and 18th greens. The Tennis Center has ten Har-Tru lighted courts and the Aquatics Center has a heated Junior Olympic-size swimming pool and playground. Inside the clubhouse is a full service Fitness Center complete with cardio equipment, weight training, aerobic exercise room, massage and personal training. In golf terms, Willow Creek Golf Club is a relative newcomer. Whereas some courses are into their second century, this is a baby, having opened in 1995.¬†But through the keen eye of golf architect Tom Jackson, Willow Creek pays tribute to the natural splendor of the terrain, giving the course a look and feel that gives the golfer the feeling of playing a much older, ‚Äútrad‚Äù golf course. Best of all for our players, Mr. Jackson‚Äôs functional layouts hold up well against time. Jackson‚Äôs golf courses around the United States are all considered masterpieces of golf design. We have a great golf course, so let‚Äôs have some fun with it! Friendly is the name of the game at Willow Creek. Since fun goes hand in hand with friendly, we‚Äôve literally made fun our goal: Mission Statement: We strive to create a fun and social golfing atmosphere that will earn the trust and friendship of our golfers. The foundation of our Golf Club is built on the principles of friendly, professional, and dedicated service. These principles are accompanied by our goal to provide quality and¬†enjoyable course conditions and ensure the growth and existence of the game of golf. We want our Members and Guests to feel like our Golf Club is their home away from home.
